metadata.title: CVE-2014-4966 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Ansible before 1.6.7 does not prevent inventory data with "{{" and "lookup"substrings, and does not prevent remote data with "{{" substrings, whichallows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via (1) craftedlookup('pipe') calls or (2) crafted Jinja2 data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4966` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 1.5.4+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
ansible-fireball - 1.5.4+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
ansible-node-fireball - 1.5.4+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ansible package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.4+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm2').
